reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: British Council - Colombia - Newton Fund

description.narrative: The Newton Fund uses science and innovation partnerships to promote economic development and social welfare of partner countries.

The Newton Fund's primary objective is to reduce poverty by generating and putting into use knowledge and technology to address development challenges and advance development for the poorest people and countries. We will seek to maximise the practical impact of research and innovation to improve the lives and opportunities of the global poor. In achieving this we will grow the research and innovation capacity of developing countries, as well as contributing to the continued strength of the UK’s research and innovation system, and support our wider prosperity and global influence.

title.narrative: Researcher Links Workshop Call June

description.narrative: Joint workshops on priority research areas, with a focus on building capacity of early career researchers

reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: Professional development - Royalties

description.narrative: Build a sustainable network of Science Technology and Innovation project formulation professionals with presence all around the country through a PD&E training on the area. Provide consultancy on the formulation of key projects on priority areas for the 32 Colombian regions + Bogota.

To support skills development in researchers, research managers, and support staff, to give them the knowledge and skills they need to better access funding, communicate their research, translate their research into benefit and work strategically and internationally. To support dialogue and knowledge exchange on research governance and strategic research policy development to ensure that the research environment in partner countries is more conducive to achieving maximum impact from high quality research.

title.narrative: Professional Development - Digitalisation of flora catalogue

description.narrative: Grant for Bio diversity research and innovation to be developed by UK expert entities in accordance to priorities set in partner countries which strengthens the development of a sustainable bio-economy

To support the development of Colombia's bio-economy based on the research of their bio diversity mainly located in regions which have gone through the armed conflict and which populations need to be provided with new sources of income.
